Description: Handle-plate of Attic black-figured pottery column-krater; on top, black-figure decoration consisting of siren (only top of head missing; with added red on face and wing) to right, looking back; narrow black framing lines around; edges and underside glazed (fired partly red).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The handle-plate may belong to the same column-krater as Alexandria 9355. Alexandridou wrongly credits Beazley with the attribution to the Painter of Berlin 1659. The attribution was made by G. Bakir, in Berlin F 1659 Ressami (1982), Izmir, p. 17.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 40, pl. XX, no. 27)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 260, no. B178)
Alexandridou 2011 / The Early Black-Figured Pottery of Attika in Context (c. 630-570BCE) (p. 123) (Naukratis 99)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0938)
